mdRecord.dcterms:title: Covered Bridge at Wawona, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Clark, Galen (Canadian outdoorsman and author, 1814-1910, active in the United States) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The open bridge (without the covering) was built by Galen Clark, the steward of what was then called the Yosemite Grant, in 1868, without its cladding. The modified queen post truss was covered with Douglas fir cladding in 1878, enclosing the Ponderosa pine structure and its iron tie rods. The bridge served automobile traffic until 1937, when a new bridge was built about 200 metres (660 ft) to the southwest. The bridge was repaired by Civilian Conservation Corps labor the same year. Since 1957 the bridge has had a number of repairs and replacements as materials have deteriorated. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wawona_Covered_Bridge [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning

Yosemite National Park (Calif.)
bridges (built works)
